intro: Tetracera nordtiana var. nordtiana, commonly known as the northern tetracera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in lowland rainforests and is often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
